commit_message:
Config changes

Removed unused macs2 options.
Added options for deciding to run ngsplot since it only works natively for select organisms/genome builds.
Refactored some rules for conditional input.
Removed chipseeker step from automation due to errors in installation of env.

Create pepr_chipseeker.smk

Annotation step. This will work well with major model organisms.

Removed helper scripts and metadata for annotation.

Going to keep it simple.

Began building scripts for peak annotation

Not even close to finished:
1. Fix structure, inputs for databases in the helper files
2. Add the rest of the options
3. Wrap this in a config option for for non-custom annotations --?

Added parsing step to pepr output files.

PePr output files contain ###.0, in stead of integers. Many annotation tools complain about that, so I fixed that and added 'chr' as a prefix to the peaks. There is not a 'chr' containing file and one without the prefix. Either can be used depending on the what the tool might need/like and the genome of interest.
Added peak calling with PePr, updated ReadMe

Added step to alter, sort, reindex the filtered bams.

ngsplot uses reference genomes with the 'chr' notation at the beginning of the chromosomes. Using Ensembl genome builds, as I almost always do, means that the bam files must be altered, sorted, and reindexed to work with ngsplot. An option in the config file, if set to Y, will change in input of the ngsplot step to account for this.

ngsplot fixes

Fix scripts, rule. Must load env directly because installing genomes causes conda temp env install to fail.

Added ngsplot rule.

Edited ngs_config_generate.r to make first argument the directory.

Will need to improve the script later.

Added calculateNSCRSC.smk

Edited calculateNSCRSC.r to add output directory. It's positional, with input file and output directory.

Will need to think about adding options instead, likely with argparse type tool.
Added index, align, fastqc, trim, and other rules.
Update ReadMe, add files from titan as a base to edit from
